item.title: Reliance unveils $110B AI investment plan as India ramps up tech ambitions
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Reliance has begun building multi-gigawatt AI data centers in Jamnagar, with more than 120 MW of capacity expected to come online in 2026.

item.title: OpenAI taps Tata for 100MW AI data center capacity in India, eyes 1GW
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: OpenAI also plans to expand its presence in India with new offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru later this year.

item.title: OpenAI deepens India push with Pine Labs fintech partnership
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: OpenAI moves beyond ChatGPT in India with a Pine Labs deal targeting enterprise payments and AI-driven commerce.

item.title: Is your startup’s check engine light on? Google Cloud’s VP explains what to do
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to GPUs, and foundation models have made it easier to get started, but those early infrastructure choices can have unforeseen consequences once startups move beyond […]

item.title: Google Cloud’s VP for startups on reading your ‘check engine light’ before it’s too late
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to GPUs, and foundation models have made it easier to get started, but those early infrastructure choices can have unforeseen consequences once startups move beyond […]

item.title: Amazon halts Blue Jay robotics project after less than 6 months
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon said Blue Jay's core tech will be used for other robotics projects and the employees who worked on it were moved to other projects.

item.title: World Labs lands $1B, with $200M from Autodesk, to bring world models into 3D workflows
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The partnership will see the two companies exploring how World Labs’ models can work alongside Autodesk’s tools, and vice versa, starting with a focus on entertainment use cases.

item.title: Google adds music-generation capabilities to the Gemini app
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Users will be able to use text, images, and videos as a reference to generate music.

item.title: Kana emerges from stealth with $15M to build flexible AI agents for marketers
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Kana, a new AI marketing startup from the founders of Rapt and Krux, has raised $15 million to build customizable, agent-based marketing tools.

item.title: Microsoft says Office bug exposed customers’ confidential emails to Copilot AI
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Microsoft said the bug meant that its Copilot AI chatbot was reading and summarizing paying customers' confidential emails, bypassing data-protection policies.

item.title: OpenAI pushes into higher education as India seeks to scale AI skills
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: OpenAI says its India education partnerships aim to reach more than 100,000 students, faculty, and staff over the next year.

item.title: India’s Sarvam wants to bring its AI models to feature phones, cars, and smart glasses
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.

item.title: Indian AI lab Sarvam’s new models are a major bet on the viability of open source AI
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The new lineup includes 30-billion- and 105-billion-parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.

item.title: Apple is reportedly cooking up a trio of AI wearables
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: As the AI hardware space heats up, the iPhone maker has multiple smart products in development.

item.title: Anthropic releases Sonnet 4.6
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Anthropic has released a new version of its midsized Sonnet model, keeping pace with the company's four-month update cycle.

item.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

item.title: SpaceX vets raise $50M Series A for data center links
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: Mesh aims to mass-produce optical transceivers for AI data centers.

item.title: Running AI models is turning into a memory game
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: When we talk about the cost of AI infrastructure, the focus is usually on Nvidia and GPUs -- but memory is an increasingly important part of the picture.

item.title: European Parliament blocks AI on lawmakers’ devices, citing security risks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: EU lawmakers found their government-issued devices were blocked from using the baked-in AI tools, amid fears that sensitive information could turn up on the U.S. servers of AI companies.

item.title: WordPress.com adds an AI Assistant that can edit, adjust styles, create images, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The feature is designed to work inside the website to understand its content and layout, allowing site owners to make changes with natural language commands. The WordPress AI assistant doesn't need precisely tailored prompts, either.
